p: In the present study, adequate data were generated that uphold the claimed antihyperglycemic activity of the medicinal plant Ajuga integrifolia in the community. Hence, it can be concluded that Ajuga integrifolia, especially at 200 mg/kg and 400 mg/kg of bodyweight of both the crude extract and aqueous solvent fraction, is remarkably effective against STZ-induced diabetic mice models as well as in the oral glucose loaded mice models, thereby validating its ethnomedicinal usage. As far as the major finding of this investigation is concerned, Ajuga integrifolia root extract has antihyperglycemic activities. According to the findings, the use of Ajuga integrifolia for treatment of diabetes mellitus by a traditional healer is supported by this study.
